description: The understanding of the mechanical and biological principles underpinning exercise science and their relation to the interaction of the human body and the physical world. Principles of motion, force, friction, gait, muscle and its neural activation as it relates to exercise science and clinical exercise prescription are covered. This course had the previous code of HMST7630 which can be viewed in the archived area within the Course and Program site http://www.uq.edu.au/study/archive/index.html
incompatible: HMST2630; HM263 + (HM264 or 265); HMST2630 or BIOL2630
